Explore Sidi Ifni

Discover the authentic beauty of Sidi Ifni, a Moroccan treasure where colonial history meets breathtaking landscapes. Stroll along wild beaches, wander through vibrant markets, and immerse yourself in a rich culture blending land and sea.

Explore

Key Personalities in SIDI IFNI History :

SIDI IFNI has marked history thanks to influential figures. Of the king Hassan II, who recovered the city in 1969, from Mustapha Baitas, man politician from the region, through the historian René Pélissier, everyone contributed to making this city a symbol of memory and identity.

Hassan II

Late HM Hassan II: The late King of Morocco played a key role in the recovery of Sidi Ifni in 1969. His visit to Sidi Ifni on the 18th May 1972 reinforced the strategic importance of the city and Saharan provinces for the Kingdom.

Mustapha Baïtas

Mustapha Baïtas: Born May 7, 1977 in Sidi Ifni, he is a man Moroccan politician member of the National Rally of independent (RNI). Since October 7, 2021, he has held the position Minister Delegate to the Head of Government in charge of Relations with parliament and government spokesperson.

René Pélissier

René Pélissier: Historian and specialist in Portuguese-speaking Africa and Spanish-speaking, he wrote on the history of Sidi Ifni, notably in connection with the retrocession of this territory from Spain to Morocco in 1969.
